intro: Miconia bipatrialis subsp. peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian miconia, is a species of flowering plant in the Melastomataceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in Peru and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as montane forests. The species is noted for its ornamental value and has been introduced to other regions, though it can become invasive in some areas.
